{{Unreferenced|date=July 2009}}
{{Infobox university | name = Alrafidain University College | native_name = كلية الرافدين الجامعة | image_name = | image_size = | image_alt = | caption = | latin_name = | motto = | established = 1988 | closed = | type = [[private university|private]] | calendar = | chairman = Dr. Mahmoud Jawad | chancellor = | president = | vice-president = | superintendent = | provost = | vice_chancellor = | rector = | principal = | dean = | director = | city = [[Al-Rusafa, Iraq|Rusafa]] | state = | province = [[Baghdad]] | country = [[Iraq]] | coor = {{Coord|33|21|51|N|44|24|26|E|display=title}} | former_names = | free_label = | free = | colors = | website = [http://www.coalrafidain.edu.iq www.coalrafidain.edu.iq] }}
'''Al Rafidain University College''' Al-Rafidain College is a private academic institution in higher education of public interest established IN 23/11/1988. It's founded by The Iraqi Society for Statistical Sciences. The actual work study started in 1988/1989 and is considered one of the oldest private academic colleges in Iraq. The college awards bachelor's degrees in various scientific disciplines and is subject to the laws, regulations, instructions and regulations of the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research through direct scientific and educational supervision on its various activities. Granted by the college recognized by that ministry. Al-Rafidain University currently includes thirteen medical, engineering and scientific departments. The duration of the study in each stage is four years. The student is awarded a bachelor's degree in engineering and science in his specialization, except for the Department of Dentistry and Pharmacy. The academic system in the college is an annual system consisting of two semesters except for the pharmacy department, which apply the semester system. The certificates granted to the student are approved by the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research and other relevant ministries for the purposes of recruitment and studies. The university has a number of different faculties, including 12 medical labs, 25 engineering and scientific laboratories, as well as 60 classrooms and 40 halls in another building. The college also has artistic, cultural and poetry activities as well as annual scientific conferences and seminars as well as sports activities.
== College Buildings ==
College now has three buildings, the main building located in Palestine Avenue / Baghdad distract , which contains the Deanship of the College and some engineering and scientific departments such as communications engineering and computer technology engineering, the second building located in AL- Banook Avenue / Baghdad district which contains other engineering and scientific departments such as cooling and air conditioning engineering, and the building of the dental hospital in the Cairo Avenue / Baghdad .
== Faculties ==
The College includes study in:
* [[Computer]] and [[Communications]] * [[Computer Engineering]] * [[Civil Engineering]] * [[Telecommunications Engineering]] * [[Law]] * [[Pathology]] * [[Business Management]] * [[Computer Science]] * [[Administration (business)|Administration]] * [[Accounting]] * [[Refrigeration]] and [[Air Conditioning]]. * [[Pharmacy]] * [[Dentistry]] .
== College Council ==
The College Council (the highest scientific and administrative authority in the College) is formed according to the Iraqi Universities and Colleges Law. It consist of the dean of the college, the members of the heads of scientific departments, the dean's assistant and a representative of the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research who meets the requirements of the college member and one of the specialized experts chosen by the Council The College is for a period of two years and is renewable once and one representative from the institution of the university who meets the requirements of the faculty. The College Council may summon, when necessary, to attend its sessions, the opinion of which is to use its competency and expertise and has no right to vote. The College Council shall undertake the implementation of the College's scientific and educational policy and shall approve the curriculum and vocabulary of the academic subjects and the granting of certificates and degrees according to the laws and regulations in force. It will organize the scientific research and provide its requirements and the use of lecturers from inside and outside the country
== See also == * [[List of universities in Iraq]]
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110319104727/http://www.mohesr.gov.iq/EngPages/SPUniEmailsiteE.htm Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research list of private universities] * [http://www.coalrafidain.edu.iq/ Al Rafidain University College]

{{Iraq-university-stub}}

{{Multiple issues| {{unreliable sources|date=September 2016}} {{citation style|date=May 2015}} }} {{Infobox person | name = Antonio Buehler | image = Antonio Buehler Filming With Iphone.jpg | caption = Antonio Buehler | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1977|06|11}} | birth_place = [[Fayetteville, North Carolina]] | residence = [[Austin, Texas]] | education = | alma_mater = [[United States Military Academy]] at [[West Point]]
[[Stanford Graduate School of Business]]
[[Harvard Graduate School of Education]] | known for = Abrome
Peaceful Streets Project | occupation = | salary = | networth = | height = | weight = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | signature = | website = http://peacefulstreets.com/ | footnotes = }} '''Antonio Buehler''' is an American educator, entrepreneur, and activist known for his work on [[police accountability]] and his pursuit of a more widely recognized [[First Amendment to the United States Constitution|constitutional right]] to photograph, film and document the public activities of police.[http://www.statesman.com/news/news/crime-law/federal-judge-upholds-activist-antonio-buehlers-ri/ngnbp/ Federal judge upholds activist Antonio Buehler’s right to film officers] Austin American-Statesman[http://www.dailytexanonline.com/2015/03/27/texas-lawmaker-proposes-bill-limiting-citizens-ability-to-record-police-officers Texas lawmaker proposes bill limiting citizens' ability to record police officers ] The Daily Texan{{cite web|url=https://newrepublic.com/article/131768/first-amendment-protect-people-film-police|title=Does the First Amendment Protect People Who Film the Police?|publisher=}}Calvert, Clay, “The First Amendment Right to Record Images of Police in Public Places: The Unreasonable Slipperiness of Reasonableness & Possible Paths Forward” 3 Tex. A&M L. Rev. 131, 140 (2015) (“[F]our federal appellate circuits now recognize a First Amendment right to film police doing their jobs in public places, [but] that right is qualified rather than absolute . . . some federal circuits have rejected the very existence of a clearly established First Amendment right to record police, be it qualified or absolute.”). In 2012, Buehler was arrested in Austin, Texas, for video-recording police after he allegedly witnessed a woman being abused by officers. After the arrest, Buehler co-founded the Peaceful Streets Project, an organization that trains the public to [[sousveillance|record police activity]].The Police And The Right To Photograph. ''News Photographer''. 69 (6): 8. July/August 2014. {{issn|0199-2422}} Buehler has been arrested a total of six times, has had twelve criminal charges filed against him, and has had dozens of criminal investigations initiated against him. ==Early life, education, and experience== Antonio Buehler was born in [[Fayetteville, North Carolina]] in 1977. He attended [[Pottsville Area High School]] in [[Pottsville, Pennsylvania]] where he was an All-Anthracite football player.Dietz, Doyle (January 1, 1995). [https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=M_ghAAAAIBAJ&sjid=KqIFAAAAIBAJ&pg=1238%2C269441 Berwick dominates big-school team]. ''Reading Eagle'', p. D11. Antonio graduated from the United States Military Academy at West Point and later from the [[Stanford Graduate School of Business]]https://www.ouramericainitiative.com/educational-choices.html and the [[Harvard Graduate School of Education]].{{cite web|url=http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/tedxhgse/speakers-and-performers |title=Speakers and Performers|publisher=}} Buehler also served in the Iraq War.{{cite web|url=http://www.democracynow.org/2014/10/29/is_filming_a_police_officer_a |title=Is Filming a Police Officer a "“Domestic Threat"”? Austin Activist on Trial for Videotaping an Arrest|publisher=}} ==Alternative education== Buehler has given numerous talks on [[college admissions]], [[alternative education]], [[homeschooling]] and other education topics at schools, libraries, and conferences across the country. In 2014, Buehler launched Abrome.{{cite web|url=http://abrome.com/ |title=Abrome|publisher=}} Initially, Abrome was an online education service, but as of 2016 it is now an alternative, progressive school in Austin, TX, that operates free of teachers, classrooms, testing, homework, or grades.{{cite web |url=https://www.altedaustin.com/alternative-school-directory/ |title= alternative school directory |accessdate=18 December 2016}} Abrome claims to have gotten approximately 50% of their clients into [[Harvard University|Harvard]] and/or [[Stanford University|Stanford Universities]], and 75% of their clients into a top ten college.{{cite web |url=http://www.abrome.com/college-acceptances/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-06-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160615131533/http://www.abrome.com/college-acceptances |archivedate=2016-06-15 |df= }} Buehler sits on the Educational Choices Advisory Council for the Our America Initiative that is associated with former New Mexico Governor Gary Johnson. ==New Year's Day 2012 incident== In the early hours of New Year’s Day 2012, Buehler, the [[designated driver]] that night, pulled into a 7-11 in Austin, TX for gas.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qNVZDpGCKks |title=West Point Grad Arrested For Defending Woman Abused By Austin Police - |first=Mike|last=Hanson|date=4 January 2012|publisher=|via=YouTube}} While fueling up, he and his passenger observed a DWI stop in progress, with a woman in high heels, the driver of the automobile, being subjected to a field sobriety test being conducted by an Austin police officer; according to Buehler, they then heard a female screaming and turned in time to see officer Robert Snider forcefully pulling another female from the passenger side of the vehicle, throwing her to the ground and pinning her arms behind her back.[http://austinist.com/2012/01/06/war_veteran_accuses_apd_officers_of.php War Veteran Accuses APD Officers of Assault on DWI Suspect: Austinist] austinist.com January 6, 2012 Buehler yelled out to the police, asking them why they were assaulting her.[http://www.kvue.com/home/Two-APD-officers-accused-of-abuse-during-New-Years-arrest-136709358.html APD officers accused of abuse during New Year's arrest] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120430050700/http://www.kvue.com/home/Two-APD-officers-accused-of-abuse-during-New-Years-arrest-136709358.html |date=April 30, 2012 }} kvue.com Austin After twisting her arms behind her back, the officers arrested her. Officer Patrick Oborski then approached Buehler, pushed him forcefully several times in the chest, and arrested him.[http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/war-veteran-antonio-buehler-takes-apd-years-melee/article13982/ War veteran Antonio Buehler continues fight with Austin Police] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120825152834/http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/war-veteran-antonio-buehler-takes-apd-years-melee/article13982/ |date=August 25, 2012 }} digitaltexan.net[http://www.kvue.com/home/Buehler-in-court-on-harrassment-charge-140133903.html Buehler in court fighting New Year's Day charges] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120901140450/http://www.kvue.com/home/Buehler-in-court-on-harrassment-charge-140133903.html |date=September 1, 2012 }} kvue.com Austin Oborski later claimed Buehler spat on him,[http://www.kvue.com/home/Buehler-hires-high-profile-attorney-to-fight-New-Years-Day-charges-138575094.html Buehler hires high-profile attorney to fight New Year's Day charges] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120421035058/http://www.kvue.com/home/Buehler-hires-high-profile-attorney-to-fight-New-Years-Day-charges-138575094.html |date=April 21, 2012 }} kvue.com Austin a felony charge that carries up to a 10-year prison sentence.[https://web.archive.org/web/20120626193026/http://www.pixiq.com/article/austin-man-facing-10-years-in-prison Austin Man Facing 10 Years in Prison After Photographing Cops Making Arrest ] Pixiq Witness video evidence does not show Buehler spitting, Oborski did not wipe his face, and [[Austin Police Department]] (APD) spokesman Corporal Hipolito admitted to KEYE news that he could not see Buehler spitting on the officer.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qVqZXmhot9w Austin Police Spokesman Says No Video Evidence Of Antonio Buehler Spitting On Officer Pat Oborski] YouTube[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s4RMIeDgGfY No Spit! No Wipe! Officer Patrick Oborski Lies About Antonio Buehler Spitting In His Face!] YouTube {|class="toccolours" style="float: right; margin-left: 2em; margin-right: 1em; font-size: 85%; background:#E9F7FF; color:black; width:37em; max-width: 37%;" cellspacing="5" |style="text-align: left;"| “I don’t feel vindicated, nor do I think I ‘won.’ The cops who committed crimes that night were never tried, arrested, fired, disciplined, or even reprimanded. Instead, Norma and I were charged with a total of six crimes we did not commit, and it took nearly three years to make them disappear. And I still have three more trials coming up for the ‘crime’ of filming the police. The city had eight prosecutors in the courtroom trying this case, and about a dozen police officers were in there to intimidate the jury. When cops and prosecutors are willing to expend such tremendous resources to prosecute a Class C Misdemeanor for political purposes, all Americans should fear their government.” |- |style="text-align: left;"|—Antonio Buehler, following his acquittal on October 29, 2014, "after four days of proceedings and more than five hours of jury deliberation" [http://www.democracynow.org/2014/10/29/is_filming_a_police_officer_a Is Filming a Police Officer a "Domestic Threat"? Austin Activist on Trial for Videotaping an Arrest], [[DemocracyNow]], October 29, 2014 |} After an online appeal by Buehler to find witnesses to the event, several witnesses came forward{{cite web|url=http://www.kens5.com/news/More-witnesses-come-forward-following-New-Years-Day-arrest-137218253.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-07-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120125142238/http://www.kens5.com/news/More-witnesses-come-forward-following-New-Years-Day-arrest-137218253.html |archivedate=2012-01-25 |df= }} and a videorecording[{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FjZpJTwAS1I |title=Austin Police Department Incident|first=|last=utube6688|date=3 January 2012|publisher=|via=YouTube}} of the incident surfaced.[http://www.kvue.com/home/More-witnesses-come-forward-following-and-APD-New-Years-Day-arrest-137149443.html More witnesses come forward following New Year's Day arrest] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120628201857/http://www.kvue.com/home/More-witnesses-come-forward-following-and-APD-New-Years-Day-arrest-137149443.html |date=June 28, 2012 }} kvue.com Austin APD has yet to release the [[dashcam]] videos from Oborski or Snider's vehicles to the public. Nearly 8,200 people have joined the Free Antonio Buehler{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/groups/350955711587953/ |title=Facebook |publisher=Facebook |date= |accessdate=2013-06-29}} Facebook page, with supporters flyering the city and organizing rallies in support of Buehler, and posting daily stories of American and international police abuse.[http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/army-ranger-antonio-buehler-supporters-protest-apd-headquarters/article16767/ Army Ranger Antonio Buehler and supporters protest at APD Headquarters] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120717053508/http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/army-ranger-antonio-buehler-supporters-protest-apd-headquarters/article16767/ |date=July 17, 2012 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.facebook.com/groups/350955711587953/ |title=Facebook |publisher=Facebook |date= |accessdate=2013-06-29}} Despite a half dozen witnesses, two videos and audio evidence of what happened on New Year's Day, the District Attorney did not convene a grand jury in 2012. His grand jury date was then postponed numerous times.[http://www.kvue.com/home/Antonio-Buehler-scheduled-for-court-144167535.html Antonio Buehler scheduled for court] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120628003920/http://www.kvue.com/home/Antonio-Buehler-scheduled-for-court-144167535.html |date=June 28, 2012 }} kvue.com Austin The grand jury finally convened on March 5, 6 and 7, 2013. Four weeks later, the District Attorney finally informed the public that the grand jury failed to indict Antonio Buehler on any of the crimes with which he was charged.{{cite web|url=http://austin.ynn.com/content/top_stories/291257/district-attorney--no-felony-indictment-for-antonio-buehler |title=Spectrum News Austin|website=austin.ynn.com}}Antonio Buehler YNN Your News Now[http://www.myfoxaustin.com/story/21859153/antonio-buehler-charged-for-incidents-with-apd Antonio Buehler charged for incidents with APD] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140110084954/http://www.myfoxaustin.com/story/21859153/antonio-buehler-charged-for-incidents-with-apd |date=January 10, 2014 }} myfoxaustin.com[http://www.statesman.com/news/news/crime-law/grand-jury-decides-not-to-indict-activist-antonio-/nW968/ No felony indictments for activist Buehler, arresting officer] www.statesman.com They instead indicted him on four Class C misdemeanors. Three for "failure to obey a lawful order" related to his New Year's Day incident, and two follow on arrests. The fourth indictment was for "interfering" in an incident in which he was never arrested. The grand jury also indicted Norma Pizana for resisting arrest. Pizana is the woman that Buehler felt was being abused on New Year's Day 2012.https://www.co.travis.tx.us/district_attorney/pdf/pr/2013/OborskiBuehlerGJ.pdf October 29, 2014, after an unprecedented four-day Class C Misdemeanor trial that spanned a full calendar week, Buehler was acquitted of charges and found not guilty of failing to comply with the order of a police officer on New Year’s Day 2012."[http://www.statesman.com/news/news/crime-law/after-juror-exit-judge-allows-activist-buehlers-ca/nhtks/ Buehler acquitted of failing to comply with officer’s order] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141030194025/http://www.statesman.com/news/news/crime-law/after-juror-exit-judge-allows-activist-buehlers-ca/nhtks/# |date=2014-10-30 }} Austin American-Statesman[http://www.austinchronicle.com/news/2014-10-31/buehler-acquitted/ Buehler acquitted] www.austinchronicle.com October 31, 2014[http://njtoday.net/2014/10/29/fight-justice-waged-peacefully-americans-streets/ Fight justice waged peacefully americans streets] njtoday.net, October 29, 2014 The trial was unique not only in its duration, but also in the resources invested into it by the state; the state had eight prosecutors in the courtroom and over a dozen police officers.{{cite web|url=http://austin.twcnews.com/content/news/305809/antonio-buehler-acquitted-of--failure-to-obey-/|title=Spectrum News Austin|website=austin.twcnews.com}}{{cite web|url=http://photographyisnotacrime.com/2014/10/antonio-buehler-found-guilty-austin-cop-breaks-blue-code-silence-testifying-behalf/|title=Antonio Buehler Found Not Guilty After Austin Cop Breaks Blue Code - Photography is Not a Crime|publisher=}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.statesman.com/news/news/crime-law/antonio-buehler-acquitted-in-controversial-2012-ne/nhwFL/# |title=Archived copy |access-date=2014-11-01 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141101211820/http://www.statesman.com/news/news/crime-law/antonio-buehler-acquitted-in-controversial-2012-ne/nhwFL/# |archive-date=2014-11-01 |dead-url=yes |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.defendingdissent.org/now/news/austin-cop-watcher-acquitted/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-11-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141101215231/http://www.defendingdissent.org/now/news/austin-cop-watcher-acquitted/ |archivedate=2014-11-01 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.austinchronicle.com/news/2014-11-14/cop-fights-law-law-wins/|title=APD Officer Suspended After Defending Antonio Buehler|publisher=}} ===Civil rights lawsuits=== On December 31, 2013, Buehler, while awaiting trial, sued the [[Austin Police Department]], Police Chief Art Acevedo, Officer Patrick Oborski, Officer Robert Snider, SGT Adam Johnson and Officer Justin Berry for allegedly violating his civil rights beginning with his January 1, 2012 arrest and two additional arrests which occurred on August 26 and September 21, 2012.{{cite web|url=http://america.aljazeera.com/watch/shows/the-stream/the-stream-officialblog/2014/1/8/activist-sues-austinpoliceforrighttofilmarrests.html |title=Activist sues Austin police for right to film arrests |publisher= Al Jazeera America}}{{cite web|url=http://www.statesman.com/news/news/crime-law/local-activist-antonio-buehler-sues-austin-police-/nccCL/ |title=Local activist Antonio Buehler sues Austin police, officers... |publisher= www.statesman.com}}[http://www.myfoxaustin.com/story/24387637/founder-of-peaceful-streets-project-files-suit-over-right-to-film-arrest Peaceful Streets Project Founder files suit over right to film a] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140110092704/http://www.myfoxaustin.com/story/24387637/founder-of-peaceful-streets-project-files-suit-over-right-to-film-arrest |date=January 10, 2014 }}{{cite web|url=https://www.scribd.com/doc/197418972/Peaceful-Streets-Complaint |title=Peaceful Streets Complaint Traffic Stop Damages|website=Scribd}} {|class="toccolours" style="float: right; margin-left: 2em; margin-right: 1em; font-size: 85%; background:#E9F7FF; color:black; width:37em; max-width: 37%;" cellspacing="5" |style="text-align: left;"| “We’re in this for the long haul. And we’re hopeful that it will eventually set a precedent that will prevent people from losing their right to hold the government and police accountable just because the prosecution convinces the grand jury to indict the individual on a bogus misdemeanor that the prosecution can’t even win.” |- |style="text-align: left;"|—Antonio Buehler, after announcing plans to appeal the dismissal of his civil lawsuit {{cite web|url=http://www.austinchronicle.com/daily/news/2015-02-23/buehlers-civil-case-dismissed-for-now/ |title=Buehler's Civil Case Dismissed, For Now|publisher=}} |} On June 2, 2014 the National Press Photographers Association filed an Amicus Briefhttp://blogs.nppa.org/advocacy/files/2014/06/Buehler-v-City-of-Austin-Amicus-Brief-Filed-06-02-14.pdf in support of Buehler's civil lawsuit.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.nppa.org/advocacy/2014/06/02/nppa-files-amicus-brief-supporting-right-to-photograph-and-record-police-in-public/|title=NPPA files Amicus Brief Supporting Right to Photograph and Record Police in Public NPPA Advocacy Committee|date=2 June 2014|publisher=}} On July 24, 2014, Federal Judge Mark Lane denied motions by the City of Austin to dismiss the case, finding that private citizens have the right to record officers in public places as they perform their official duties.http://www.mystatesman.com/news/news/crime-law/federal-judge-upholds-activist-antonio-buehlers-ri/ngnbp/http://cloudfront-assets.reason.com/assets/db/14063077544714.pdf Lane also said the officers were not personally immune from allegations that they had arrested and searched him without probable cause.{{cite web|url=http://reason.com/blog/2014/07/25/federal-judge-to-camera-shy-austin-cops|title=Federal Judge to Camera-Shy Austin Cops: People Have a Right to Record You. Deal With It|date=25 July 2014|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.austinchronicle.com/news/2014-08-01/buehler-lawsuit-victory/|title=Activist will sue city, Acevedo for civil rights violations|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://reason.com/archives/2015/06/23/the-right-to-record-walter-sco|title=The Right to Record Walter Scott's Death|date=23 June 2015|publisher=}} On February 20, 2015, Judge Mark Lane dismissed the lawsuit based on a Fifth Circuit precedent which stated that an indicted defendant lost their standing to sue.{{cite web|url=http://kxan.com/2015/02/20/charges-against-antonio-buehler-dropped-as-well-as-civil-suit-against-apd-dropped/ |title=Charges against Antonio Buehler dropped as well as civil suit against APD|first=Calily|last=Bien|date=21 February 2015|publisher=}} In response to the dismissal, Buehler stated, “We have waited three years for justice, and we are willing to wait even longer to expose APD for the crime they have covered up.” He also noted that the Fifth Circuit precedent provided an incentive for prosecutors to protect corrupt and criminal law enforcement officers through the simple expedient of indicting an otherwise innocent defendant.[{{cite web|url=http://www.statesman.com/news/news/local/civil-rights-suit-over-filming-austin-officers-dis/nkGDb/ |title=Civil rights suit over filming Austin officers dismissed|publisher=}} Buehler and his attorney appealed the decision on February 25, 2015. On June 2, 2016, the Fifth Circuit Court in New Orleans upheld Judge Mark Lane's decision to dismiss Buehler's lawsuit against the City of Austin and four Austin Police officers.{{cite web|url=http://www.mystatesman.com/news/news/appeals-court-rejects-lawsuit-by-filmer-of-austin-/nrYnJ/ |title=Appeals court rejects lawsuit by activist who filmed Austin police|publisher=}} On December 2, 2016, Buehler filed a petition for a writ of certiorari to have the case heard by the [[Supreme Court of the United States]].{{cite web|url=http://certpool.com/dockets/16-729|title=Antonio Francis Buehler v. Austin Police Department, et al., 16-00729 |website=certpool.com}} On January 4, 2017, the National Association for Public Defense, [[Cato Institute]], [[National Press Photographers Association]], and five media organizations filed Amicus briefs in support of Buehler's petition to the Supreme Court.{{cite web|url=https://www.cato.org/blog/when-you-sue-police-you-should-get-day-court|title=When You Sue the Police, You Should Get Your Day in Court|date=4 January 2017|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=https://www.nppa.org/news/nppa-cato-institute-file-scotus-brief-rights-record-police-activity|title=NPPA, Cato Institute File SCOTUS Brief on Rights to Record Police Activity|date=5 January 2017|publisher=}} On February 2, 2017, SCOTUSblog, the leading Supreme Court news site, listed Buehler's lawsuit as the Petition of the Day.{{cite web|url=http://www.scotusblog.com/2017/02/petition-of-the-day-1085/|title=Petition of the day SCOTUS blog|date=2 February 2017|publisher=}} The Supreme Court ultimately did not grant a writ of certiorari for Buehler's suit. On August 2, 2017, Buehler sued the City of Austin and Austin Police Department employees Randy Dear, Aljoe Garibay, Quint Sebek, Wesley Devries, John Leo Coffey, Monika McCoy, Ryan Adam, Allen Hicks, and Reginald Parker for allegedly violating his civil rights and stemming from his August 2, 2015 arrest in downtown Austin.http://www.statesman.com/news/local/cop-watching-activist-antonio-buehler-sues-city-austin-police-officers/8ytXGa2GxysDC7huPJFjHO/{{cite web|url=http://kxan.com/2017/08/02/founder-of-peaceful-streets-project-files-suit-against-austin-9-officers/|title=Founder of Peaceful Streets Project files suit against Austin, 9 officers|first=Calily|last=Bien|date=2 August 2017|publisher=}} ==Peaceful Streets Project== In the months following the incident, a group of activists from a range of backgrounds joined Buehler to start the Peaceful Streets Project, an all-volunteer, nonpartisan, grassroots effort for police accountability.[http://peacefulstreets.com/about/ About] peacefulstreets.com[http://occupyaustin.org/2012/05/meet-rubiks/ Occupy Austin | Occupy Wall Street » Blog Archive » Meet Rubiks…] May 2012[http://www.myfoxaustin.com/story/18733729/victim-of-police-brutality-launches-project-citizens Alleged victim of police brutality launches Project Citizens] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120623220738/http://www.myfoxaustin.com/story/18733729/victim-of-police-brutality-launches-project-citizens |date=June 23, 2012 }} myfoxaustin.com The group holds free community trainings on knowing your rights during police encounters, and held a day-long Police Accountability Summit in Austin, TX on July 14, 2012 where they handed out 100 handheld video-cameras to trained activists who now actively film police encounters with residents of Austin.[http://austin.ynn.com/content/top_stories/285823/peaceful-streets-project-distributes-100-cameras-to-record-police Peaceful Streets Project distributes 100 cameras to record police], YNN - Your News Now[http://www.myfoxaustin.com/story/19027249/grouop-holds-first-police-accountability-summit Group holds first police accountability summit] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120721212601/http://www.myfoxaustin.com/story/19027249/grouop-holds-first-police-accountability-summit |date=July 21, 2012 }}[http://www.copblock.org/18384/peaceful-streets-project/ Peaceful Streets Project is Leading the Way], Cop |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131101234047/http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/antonio-buehler-steps-campaign/article37848/#.UBnjM7SXR3U |date=November 1, 2013 }} digitaltexan.net, 2012[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eopoUl-wssw Peaceful Streets Project is Leading the Way] YouTube The Peaceful Streets Project has also stepped up efforts to work with and ally with other community organizations, and have participated in protests in solidarity with victims of police abuse nationally.[http://blip.tv/zgraphix/rally-against-police-abuse-in-solidarity-with-anaheim-ca-6280914 Watch Rally Against Police Abuse in Solidarity with Anaheim, CA] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130130173904/http://blip.tv/zgraphix/rally-against-police-abuse-in-solidarity-with-anaheim-ca-6280914 |date=January 30, 2013 }}. blip.tv The Peaceful Streets Project has a "Strong" social media presence with over 5,100 YouTube[https://www.youtube.com/user/PeacefulStreets] YouTube subscribers, over 4,300 followers on Twitter[https://twitter.com/PeacefulStreets PeacefulStreets] Twitter and over 20,400 likes on Facebook.[https://www.facebook.com/PeacefulStreets PeacefulStreets] facebook Buehler's efforts to expose what he considers to be police violence and the inherent corruption of the justice system[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DJCNfTUvF5M Antonio Buehler Exposes The APD Internal Affairs Coverup For The Lies Of Oborski And Snider] YouTube[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_rA-g3Kaqas Antonio Buehler And Austin Police Chief Art Acevedo On KLBJ "Dudley And Bob Show"] YouTube have resulted in numerous bloggers taking up his cause.{{cite web|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140221175922/http://thetimetimes.com/2012/07/08/austin-police-dept-corruption-exposed/|title=Austin Police Dept Corruption Exposed - The Time Times|date=21 February 2014|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.jad-davis.com/wordpress/?p=1187|title=A Typical Crime with an Atypical Victim - The jVerse|publisher=|access-date=2012-08-02|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130403095344/http://www.jad-davis.com/wordpress/?p=1187#|archive-date=2013-04-03|dead-url=yes|df=}}[http://www.dailykos.com/story/2012/06/29/1104400/-A-Veteran-Faces-Jail-Time-for-Rising-Up-Against-Injustice A Veteran Faces Jail Time for Rising Up Against Injustice], June 26, 2012. dailykos.com[http://www.americandailyherald.com/pundits/glenn-horowitz/item/antonio-buehler-wants-peaceful-streets-for-everyone Antonio Buehler Wants Peaceful Streets for Everyone] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121022021805/http://www.americandailyherald.com/pundits/glenn-horowitz/item/antonio-buehler-wants-peaceful-streets-for-everyone |date=October 22, 2012 }} americandailyherald.com In addition, numerous cities around the country have reached out to Buehler and the Peaceful Streets Project looking to set up local franchises. Peaceful Streets Project chapters now exist in nearly a dozen cities to include Houston, Dallas-Fort Worth, New York City, Manchester, Honolulu, San Antonio and Eunice, LA. Buehler has continued to wage a public fight against his criminal charges. He has claimed that the city and the Austin Police Department are intentionally engaged in a cover-up and that corruption runs throughout the city government and the police department. On June 24, 2013, Fox 7 ran a piece on Antonio Buehler wherein the President of the Austin Police Association alluded to possible violence in the future should Buehler continue to escalate his [[Copwatch|cop watching]] tactics.{{cite web|url=http://www.myfoxaustin.com/story/22672516/crimewatch-apa-fears-groups-efforts-to-keep-an-eye-on-police-may-lead-to-violence |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-06-27 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130908235158/http://www.myfoxaustin.com/story/22672516/crimewatch-apa-fears-groups-efforts-to-keep-an-eye-on-police-may-lead-to-violence |archivedate=2013-09-08 |df= }} [Crimewatch: APA fears group's efforts to keep an eye on police may lead to violence] The Peaceful Streets Project responded by organizing several more public cop watch events, Know Your Rights Trainings and a national police accountability summit in Austin on August 17, 2013.[http://www.austinchronicle.com/news/2013-08-16/seale-and-balko-visit-peaceful-streets/ Seal and Balko visit peaceful streets], austinchronicle.com, August 16, 2013 On April 12, 2014, Buehler spoke about the Peaceful Streets Project and police abuse at a [[TEDx]] event at Harvard.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W6m4ulvfZ2M Action and Empathy] YouTube On January 22, 2015, [[CBS News]] highlighted Antonio Buehler and the Peaceful Streets Project as one of two copwatch groups patrolling in Texas.http://www.cbsnews.com/news/policing-the-police-and-adding-guns-into-the-mix/ [As groups police the police, some add guns to the mix], CBS News, January 22, 2015 On May 9, 2015, [[Reveal from The Center for Investigative Reporting]] and [[The Texas Tribune]] released collaborative pieces on the direct action tactic of Filming the Police, with a focus on the Peaceful Streets Project.https://www.revealnews.org/article/texas-a-flashpoint-in-debate-over-right-to-film-police/ [Texas a flashpoint in debate over right to film police], revealnews.org, May 9, 2015http://www.texastribune.org/2015/05/09/reveal-story-1/ [Texas a Flashpoint in Debate Over Right to Film Police], The Texas Tribune, May 9, 2015 On August 20, 2015, CityLab from [[The Atlantic]] released a piece centered on Antonio Buehler and the Peaceful Streets Project about the risks of filming the police, despite the legality of doing so.http://www.citylab.com/crime/2015/08/still-dangerous-record-police-america/401795/ [The Danger in Recording a Cop], CityLab, August 20, 2015 On November 25, 2015, [[Playboy]] did a longform article on cop watching, which opened and closed with Antonio Buehler and the Peaceful Streets Project.http://www.playboy.com/articles/a-new-breed-of-activists-are-turning-cameras-on-the-police [A New Breed of Activists are Turning Cameras on the Police], Playboy, November 25, 2015 On February 26, 2016, [[Pivot.TV]]'s Truth and Power docuseries built an episode around Buehler's history and work with the Peaceful Streets Project.[http://www.takepart.com/video/2016/02/19/citizen-journalist-documents-police-truth-and-power-episode-6-clip Citizen Journalist Documents Police], Truth and Power, February 26, 2016 On March 10, 2016, [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]]'s DarkNet docuseries featured Buehler and the Peaceful Streets Project.[http://www.sho.com/dark-net/season/1/episode/8#/index REVOLT], DarkNet, March 10, 2016 In December, 2017, [[The Progressive]] featured Buehler and his work with the Peaceful Streets Project and [[Abrome]] in a three-page feature.[http://progressive.org/magazine/standing-up-to-the-police-antonio-buehler/ Antonio Buehler, Cop Watcher], The Progressive, January 4, 2018 ==Subsequent arrests and charges== ===August 24, 2012=== In the early morning hours of August 24, 2012, while cop watching with members of the Peaceful Streets Project in downtown Austin, Buehler recorded an undercover officer, Justin Berry, helping uniformed police officers arrest women for underage drinking. Although Buehler wasn't arrested for filming Berry, he was later indicted on a Class C Misdemeanor charge of "interference with public duties." Buehler was scheduled to stand trial on January 6, 2015. On January 2, 2015, the City of Austin requested the trial judge dismiss all charges against Buehler.[http://thelibertybeat.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/10738827_389967334496076_2129256336_n.pdf State vs. Antonio Buehler]{{dead link|date=October 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} thelibertybeat.com, January 2015 ===August 26, 2012=== In the early morning hours of August 26, 2012, while cop watching with members of the Peaceful Streets Project in downtown Austin, Buehler was arrested by Officer Justin Berry for "interfering with public duties" while recording an arrest.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hkDqVv1sj5M|title=Antonio Buehler again on police radar|first=|last=kxan|date=27 August 2012|publisher=|via=YouTube}}{{cite web|url=http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/austi-activist-antonio-buehler-arrested-recording-police-actions/article39149/#.UEQiXtZlRU0 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-09-03 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140109222028/http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/austi-activist-antonio-buehler-arrested-recording-police-actions/article39149/ |archivedate=2014-01-09 |df= }} The Digital Texan He was released about 17 hours later. Austin Police Department claims that he refused to back away from an arrest, causing the suspect of the arrest to become uncontrollable. Buehler claims that APD was targeting him.{{cite web|url=http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/antonio-buehler-claims-austin-police-targeting/article39388/#.Us9XQLTWvgy |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-01-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140110002826/http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/antonio-buehler-claims-austin-police-targeting/article39388/ |archivedate=2014-01-10 |df= }} The Digital Texan APD refused to return Buehler's camera to him after the incident, claiming that it was of evidentiary value. Another member of the Peaceful Streets Project was able to videorecord the arrest and posted it online before Buehler was released from jail.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vPkCq3AXWmc] YouTube Buehler was scheduled to stand trial on February 23, 2015. On February 19, 2015, the City of Austin requested the trial judge dismiss all remaining charges against Buehler.http://www.austinchronicle.com/daily/news/2015-02-19/final-charges-dropped-for-buehler/ [Final charges dropped for Buehler], austinchronicle.com, February 19, 2015 ===September 12, 2012=== In the early morning hours of September 21, 2012, while cop watching with members of the Peaceful Streets Project in downtown Austin, Buehler was again arrested, this time with fellow police accountability activist Sarah Dickerson[http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/peaceful-streets-project-leader-antonio-buehler-arrested-recording-austin-police/article40293/ Activist Antonio Buehler arrested again by Austin police] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131101215628/http://digitaltexan.net/2012/austin-local-news/peaceful-streets-project-leader-antonio-buehler-arrested-recording-austin-police/article40293/ |date=November 1, 2013 }} digitaltexan.net Video indicates that both Buehler and Dickerson were silently filming and were further back than APD's self-described desired distance from a scene. According to Buehler and other witnesses, after refusing an order to walk toward the arresting officer and the suspect in order to join other members of the Peaceful Street Project, and despite continually asking how far he needed to move back, and continuing to move back away from the scene, Buehler was given an ultimatum to either join other members of the Peaceful Streets Project, or leave. When Buehler said he was leaving, he was arrested. As Dickerson filmed Buehler's arrest, she too was arrested. Both were charged with "interfering with public duties."[http://dailytexanonline.com/news/2012/09/25/a-new-lense-for-arrest A new lense for arrest] [[The Daily Texan]], September 25, 2012[http://my.firedoglake.com/kitoconnell/2012/09/24/peacefulstreets-project-more-unconstitutional-copwatching-arrests-in-austin/ More Unconstitutional Copwatching Arrests in Austin], MyFDL, September 25, 2012{{cite web|url=http://www.copblock.org/21415/activists-response-to-arrests-of-herself-and-antonio-buehler/|title=Activist's Response to Arrests of Herself and Antonio Buehler - Cop Block|date=24 September 2012|publisher=}}[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0XT2kqBlr5k The THIRD False Arrest of Antonio Buehler (Founder, Peaceful Streets Project)] YouTube Austin Police Department confiscated both Buehler and Dickerson's cameras and have not yet returned them. This most recent arrest has drawn the ire of the National Press Photographers Association which sent a letter to Austin Police Chief Art Acevedo criticizing the actions of APD toward those who film police.[https://web.archive.org/web/20120927000241/http://www.pixiq.com/article/austin-police-need-to-be-investigated-by-usdoj Austin Police Revealing Pattern of Abuse Against Citizens who Record], Pixiq, September 27, 2012 ===March 13, 2013=== On March 13, 2013, Buehler was arrested for [[disorderly conduct]] in Gonzales, Texas, for telling a police officer to "go fuck yourself."[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZC2AgYL1zSY Antonio Buehler Arrested In Gonzales Texas] YouTube On June 5, 2013, Buehler defended himself [[pro se]]. After a seven-hour trial, the jury found him guilty and assessed a $1 fine.[http://thelibertybeat.com/peaceful-streets-project-founder-antonio-buehler-walks-with-1-fine-in-latest-trial/ Peaceful Streets Project Founder Antonio Buehler Walks with $1 Fine in Latest Trial] The Liberty Beat Buehler was awarded a new trial which began on February 23, 2015 at [[Gonzales County]] Court. A mistrial was declared due to an error on the judge's part, which was caught by defense counsel. A new appeal trial was scheduled for March 30, 2015. That trial was postponed at the request of the prosecutor. A new trial was then scheduled for May 20, 2015. That trial was postponed after the court informed the defense that they had forgotten to send out jury summonses. The next trial date was set for June 25, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://photographyisnotacrime.com/2015/06/peaceful-streets-founder-antonio-buehler-heads-to-trial/|title=Peaceful Streets Founder Antonio Buehler Heads to Trial - Photography is Not a Crime|publisher=}} On June 25, 2015, after a trial in which the prosecution only called one witness, and the defense called a half dozen, the jury deadlocked at 3-3 and the Judge declared a mistrial.[http://www.gonzalescannon.com/articles/2015/07/07/jury-split-first-amendment-trial Jury split on first amendment trial] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150811075007/http://gonzalescannon.com/articles/2015/07/07/jury-split-first-amendment-trial# |date=2015-08-11 }} The Gonzales Cannon A few weeks later, the prosecutor requested that the charge be dismissed because he would be "[u]nable to prove case beyond a reasonable doubt."[http://www.gonzalescannon.com/articles/2015/07/24/charges-buehler-trial-dropped Charges in Buehler trial dropped] The Gonzales Cannon In a statement, Buehler stated, “It has become clear to me that in order for people to see justice within the system, they need to have tremendous resources in terms of connections, finances, and time.” [http://thelibertybeat.com/mistrial-declared-in-antonio-buehler-free-speech-appeal/ Mistrial Declared in Antonio Buehler Free Speech Appeal] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150224213313/http://thelibertybeat.com/mistrial-declared-in-antonio-buehler-free-speech-appeal/ |date=February 24, 2015 }} The Liberty Beat {|class="toccolours" style="float: right; margin-left: 2em; margin-right: 1em; font-size: 85%; background:#E9F7FF; color:black; width:50em; max-width: 50%;" cellspacing="5" |style="text-align: left;"| “I think this would have been a great opportunity for people to once again see how the Austin Police Department and city prosecutors use city ordinances to victimize people who have already been victimized by the police. It also would have opened people’s eyes to how corrupt the grand jury process can be.” |- |style="text-align: left;"|—Antonio Buehler, following the first dismissal on January 5, 2015 {{cite web|url=http://www.austinchronicle.com/daily/news/2015-01-05/buehlers-case-dismissed/|title=Buehler's Case Dismissed|publisher=}} |} ===Austin, TX charges dropped=== Between jury trials scheduled for January and February 2015, the outstanding criminal charges stemming from the August 24, 2015, August 26, 2015, and September 21, 2015 incidents were dropped. On January 5, 2015, the state's motion to drop one set of charges was accepted.[http://www.austinchronicle.com/daily/news/2015-01-05/buehlers-case-dismissed/ Buehler's Case Dismissed], austinchronicle.com, January 5, 2015 The final set of charges pending against Buehler were similarly dropped on February 19, 2015, "clearing the way for a meeting between city prosecutors and the police accountability activist in federal court" on March 2, 2015.[http://www.austinchronicle.com/daily/news/2015-02-19/final-charges-dropped-for-buehler/ Final Charges Dropped], austinchronicle.com, March 2, 2015 On February 20, one day after the last of the charges were dropped, "Judge Mark Lane dismissed Buehler’s federal civil lawsuit against the Austin Police Department and its officers." [http://kxan.com/2015/02/20/charges-against-antonio-buehler-dropped-as-well-as-civil-suit-against-apd-dropped/ Charges against Antonio Buehler dropped as well as civil suit against APD], kxan.com, February 20, 2015[http://www.statesman.com/news/news/local/civil-rights-suit-over-filming-austin-officers-dis/nkGDb/ Civil rights suit over filming Austin officers dismissed] statesman.com ===August 2, 2015=== On August 2, 2015, Buehler was cop watching with members of the Peaceful Streets Project and Film the Police-Portland in downtown Austin. At multiple points throughout the night, Austin Police officers approached him and told him to step back while he was filming them. At approximately 1:45 a.m., SGT Randy Dear called his subordinate officers into a huddle, and when he emerged he approached Buehler again and told him that "the next time we go to a disturbance and y'all get in the way ... the next time you're interfering, you're going to be arrested." When Buehler asked for a clarification on how what the cop watchers were doing qualified as interference, Dear said, "You've been warned, sir." [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7ktkUingcOs APD arrests Antonio Buehler & Mike Bluehair (Camera 1)] YouTube Buehler then turned to CPL Quint Sebek and Officer Aljoe Garibay to get clarification, and Sebek responded by filming Buehler with his phone, and Garibay stated that Buehler was interfering by being in their way when they were rushing toward disturbances.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qIFItJeCM5c APD arrests Antonio Buehler & Mike Bluehair (Camera 2)] YouTube Dear then came back, positioned himself inches away from Buehler, and ignored Buehler.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kvE8qGIUPm0 APD arrests Antonio Buehler & Mike Bluehair (Camera 3)] YouTube A little over one minute later, Dear turned to Buehler and told him that he had to step back because they were about to go on patrol. While protesting what he believed was an illegal order, Buehler stepped away from Dear, but was still arrested. He was later charged with "interference with public duties" and "resisting arrest."[http://www.statesman.com/news/news/crime-law/austin-police-arrest-activist-antonio-buehler-afte/nnBph/ Austin police arrest activist Antonio Buehler after recording officers] Austin American-Statesman[http://photographyisnotacrime.com/2015/08/austin-police-arrest-peaceful-streets-founder-antonio-buehler-again-for-recording-cops-in-public/ Austin Police Arrest Peaceful Streets Founder Antonio Buehler Again for Recording Cops in Public] PINAC As Buehler was trying to hand off his cameras to other Peaceful Streets Project members, Mike "Bluehair" Smith from Film the Police-Portland was also arrested for "interference with public duties."[http://www.keyetv.com/news/features/top-stories/stories/Austin-Activist-Antonio-Buehler-Arrested-179462.shtml Austin Activist Antonio Buehler Released from Jail] KEYE TV In the days following the arrest, Buehler and the Peaceful Streets Project publicly disputed the claims made by the Austin Police Department. They ultimately produced five videos of the incident that they claim to disprove the claims made by the Officer Garibay in his arrest affidavit.[http://www.statesman.com/news/news/local/austin-police-buehler-dispute-events-that-led-to-a/nnCLn/ Austin police, Buehler dispute events that led to activist’s arrest] Austin American-Statesman[http://peacefulstreets.com/2015/08/press-release-breaking-videos-austin-police-affidavit-proven-false-by-peaceful-streets-project-videos-video-proves-illegal-and-unconstitutional-arrests/ Austin Police Affidavit Proven False by Peaceful Streets Project Videos; Video Proves Illegal and Unconstitutional Arrests] Peaceful Streets Project[http://photographyisnotacrime.com/2015/08/austin-police-account-of-antonio-buehlers-arrest-disproven-by-peaceful-streets-videos/ Austin Police Account of Antonio Buehler’s Arrest Disproven by Peaceful Streets Videos] PINAC Buehler's lawyer, Millie Thompson told the media that APD was repeating their tactic of arresting Buehler and others for legally filming them in public.[http://www.kvue.com/story/news/crime/2015/08/02/austin-police-arrest-antonio-buehler-local-activist/31026841/ Activist Antonio Buehler released after weekend arrest] KVUE[http://www.austinchronicle.com/news/2015-08-07/buehler-arrested/ Buehler Arrested] The Austin Chronicle The Austin Police Department and the Travis County Attorney's Office issued a joint statement saying that they were dropping the charges against Buehler on November 13, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://kxan.com/2015/11/13/apd-drops-august-charges-against-antonio-buehler/|title=APD drops August charges against Antonio Buehler|first=Calily|last=Bien|date=13 November 2015|publisher=}} Currently, Buehler has no outstanding criminal charges. ==Public Safety Commission== In May 2015, Buehler was nominated to serve on the Austin Public Safety Commission by Council Member Don Zimmerman.http://www.statesman.com/news/news/local-govt-politics/activist-antonio-buehler-nominated-for-austin-publ/nk8ff/ [Activist Antonio Buehler nominated for Austin Public Safety Commission], www.statesman.com, May 4, 2015http://kxan.com/2015/05/04/antonio-buehler-nominated-for-public-safety-commission/ [Police critic Antonio Buehler nominated for Public Safety Commission], KXAN, May 4, 2015 The Austin Police Association immediately began lobbying the city council to keep Buehler off of the commission.https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10101638642668753&set=a.863957480123.2357161.200034&type=1 [APA email] Facebook, May 7, 2015 while Buehler claimed that his place on the commission was needed in the interest of diversity of thought.http://www.myfoxaustin.com/clip/11468311/antonio-buehler-in-studio-interview [Antonio Buehler in-studio interview] myfoxaustin.com, May 7, 2015 After hearing from nearly a dozen community member supporting the nomination, Buehler said that City Council ultimately buckled under the pressure from the Austin Police Association and refused to vote on his nomination by not approving a waiver to his residency status.https://twitter.com/austintexasgov/status/596356185277800448 www.twitter.com/austintexasgov, May 7, 2015http://www.austinchronicle.com/daily/news/2015-05-08/council-says-no-to-buehler/ [Council Says "No" to Buehler, Refuses to waive residency requirement to sit on commission], austinchronicle.com, May 8, 2015http://video.statesman.com/Antonio-Buehler-speaks-after-City-Council-vote-29033627?playlistId=15517 [Antonio Buehler speaks after City Council vote], www.statesman.com, May 8, 2015 Eight minutes later the City Council approved the same waiver for another commission nominee.https://twitter.com/austintexasgov/status/596358128209403905 www.twitter.com/austintexasgov, May 7, 2015 ==Criticism== Immediately following the killing of a Deputy in Houston, TX, Buehler used the Peaceful Streets Project Facebook page to post a controversial statement that read, "Pig executed in Houston. Probably shouldn't have joined a criminal gang. His bad decisions caught up with him. Blame his parents. Or the scores of thousands of pigs who abuse people every month in America. #thuglife".{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/PeacefulStreets/posts/965572003502696|title=Peaceful Streets Project|website=www.facebook.com}} Austin Police Chief Hubert Art Acevedo reposted a screenshot of the post on his Twitter account with the commentary, "This is how mind of so-called peaceful activist works & why police officers don't want him inches from their face."{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/artacevedo/status/637638327814897664|title=Chief Art Acevedo on Twitter|publisher=}} Acevedo's statement repeated the narrative that was used to justify Buehler's arrest earlier that month, that Buehler claims were later disproven by video that the Peaceful Streets Project released.{{cite web|url=http://peacefulstreets.com/2015/08/press-release-breaking-videos-austin-police-affidavit-proven-false-by-peaceful-streets-project-videos-video-proves-illegal-and-unconstitutional-arrests/|title=BREAKING VIDEOS: Austin Police Affidavit Proven False by Peaceful Streets Project Videos; Video Proves Illegal and Unconstitutional Arrests|publisher=}} Nonetheless, the media ran multiple stories questioning Buehler's choice of words.http://www.mystatesman.com/news/news/local/herman-peaceful-streets-unpeaceful-tweets/nnWcB/ Buehler argued that he was using the same rhetoric police used after they killed suspects to highlight their hypocrisy.{{cite web|url=http://peacefulstreets.com/2015/08/the-hypocrisy-of-the-police-and-their-supporters-perpetuate-violence/|title=The hypocrisy of the police and their supporters perpetuate violence|publisher=}} Buehler and the Peaceful Streets Project would repeatedly tweet Chief Hubert Art Acevedo over the following months to highlight that Deputy Goforth was killed while cheating on his wife with a mistress at a gas station while he was supposed to be on duty,{{cite web|url=http://www.chron.com/news/houston-texas/houston/miles-goforth/article/Defense-Goforth-was-meeting-a-mistress-at-the-6519432.php|title=Defense: Goforth was meeting a woman at the time of his death|date=21 September 2015|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.inquisitr.com/2439959/darren-goforth-deputy-slain-at-gas-station-was-with-his-mistress-when-killed-affidavit-shows/|title=Darren Goforth: Deputy Slain At Gas Station Was With His Mistress When Killed, Affidavit Shows|date=22 September 2015|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3241974/Mistress-slain-Houston-police-deputy-car-murdered-gas-station.html|title=Police deputy's 'mistress' was in the car with him when he was shot|publisher=}} arguing that Deputy Goforth did indeed make a series of bad decisions.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/PeacefulStreets/status/676855112225034240|title=Peaceful Streets on Twitter|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/PeacefulStreets/status/676856822288941056|title=Peaceful Streets on Twitter|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/bgreymatter/status/668847811169943553|title=Baron of Greymatter on Twitter|publisher=}} Chief Hubert Art Acevedo would later go to the media to again complain about Buehler's words after he responded to an Austin Police Officer getting shot in April 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.kvue.com/news/local/acevedo-blasts-peaceful-streets-comments/119479965|title=APD Chief Acevedo blasts Peaceful Streets comments|publisher=}} Buehler has repeatedly claimed that "all cops are cowards," and that "cops are terrorist scum." His repeated use of these phrases has irked his critics, including Austin Police Chief Acevedo and Austin Police Association President Ken Casaday. On July 8, 2016, the German paper Kurier ran an article about Buehler calling cops terrorists{{cite web|url=http://kurier.at/chronik/weltchronik/copwatcher-in-texas-polizisten-sind-terroristen/208.626.122 |title=Copwatcher in Texas: "Polizisten sind Terroristen"|first=Thomas|last=Trescher|language=German|publisher=}} in the aftermath of the high-profile police killings of [[Alton Sterling]] and [[Philando Castile]], and the killing of five Dallas Police Officers by Micah Xavier Johnson. ==Accolades== In July 2012, Buehler was chosen to receive the Texans for Accountable Government annual Activist of the Year award.[http://www.tagtexas.org/ Texans for Accountable Government] Official TAG Website In November 2012, [[Austin Chronicle]] readers voted Antonio Buehler as Austin's Best Activist and the Peaceful Streets Project as the Best Grassroots Movement for 2012.[http://www.austinchronicle.com/gyrobase/Awards/BestOfAustin?Award=1369205 Best Activist - Antonio Buehler - Best of Austin - 2012] The Austin Chronicle[http://www.austinchronicle.com/gyrobase/Awards/BestOfAustin?Award=1369194 Best Grassroots Movement - Peaceful Streets Project - Best of Austin - 2012] The Austin Chronicle Buehler was invited to give a TEDx talk about his experiences combating police abuse at the Harvard Graduate School of Education on April 12, 2014.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W6m4ulvfZ2M|title=Action and empathy: Antonio Buehler at TEDxHGSE|first=|last=TEDx Talks|date=4 May 2014|publisher=|via=YouTube}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.abrome.com/}} *[http://www.democracynow.org/2014/10/29/is_filming_a_police_officer_a Is Filming a Police Officer a "Domestic Threat"? Austin Activist on Trial for Videotaping an Arrest] - video report by ''[[Democracy Now!]]'', October 29, 2014 *[https://www.revealnews.org/article/texas-a-flashpoint-in-debate-over-right-to-film-police/ Texas a flashpoint in debate over right to film police] - investigative report by ''[[Reveal from The Center for Investigative Reporting]]'', May 9, 2015 *[http://www.playboy.com/articles/a-new-breed-of-activists-are-turning-cameras-on-the-police A New Breed of Activists Are Turning Cameras on the Police] - investigative report by ''[[Playboy]]'', November 25, 2015 *[http://progressive.org/magazine/standing-up-to-the-police-antonio-buehler/ Antonio Buehler, Cop Watcher] by ''[[The Progressive]]'', January 4, 2018 {{DEFAULTSORT:Buehler, Antonio}} [[Category:American educators]] [[Category:American educational theorists]] [[Category:Advocates of unschooling and homeschooling]] [[Category:Education reform]] [[Category:Harvard Graduate School of Education alumni]] [[Category:Homeschooling advocates]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Police brutality in the United States]] [[Category:Social entrepreneurs]] [[Category:Stanford Graduate School of Business alumni]] [[Category:United States Military Academy alumni]] [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:People from Austin, Texas]]

revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=November 2007}} '''Bentley Schaad''' (1925–1999), was a California modernist and art educator.
Bentley Schaad was born in Los Angeles, California, in 1925.<ref>Moure, Nancy ''California Art: 450 Years of Painting & Other Media''</ref> As an art student, he attended [[Jepson Art Institute]], the [[Art Center College of Design|Art Center]] in Pasadena and the [[Claremont Colleges]]. A pupil, and later a colleague, of [[Henry Lee McFee]], Schaad learned the principles of line, color and form. His proficiency as an artist and his technical aesthetic innovations enabled him to begin teaching art at [[Otis College of Art and Design|Otis Art Institute]]. Schaad spent the majority of his career as an instructor.<ref>Bentley, Schaad, ''The Realm of Contemporary Still Life Painting''</ref>
Schaad was a prolific artist in the West Coast modernist movement along with [[Henry Lee McFee]], [[Rico Lebrun]] and [[Richard Haines]]. Schaad utilized many concepts of the modernist aesthetic in his work. His paintings were often composed of many broken planes of color — with a concentration on shape, form and structure of an object.<ref>Anderson, Alissa J., ''Bentley Schaad: California Modernist''</ref>
==References== <references /> <!-- Dead note "Anderson, Alissa J., ''Bentley Schaad: California Modernist'', [http://www.andersonshea-artappraisals.com Anderson Shea Art Appraisals] --> <!-- Dead note "Schaad": Bentley, Schaad, ''The Realm of Contemporary Still Life Painting'', Reinhold Pub. Corp (1962) --> <!-- Dead note "Moure": Moure, Nancy ''California Art: 450 Years of Painting & Other Media'', ISBN 978-0-9614622-4-6 -->
==External links== *[http://www.andersonshea-artappraisals.com/artists/schaad.html Bentley Schaad biography] *[http://www.askart.com/AskART/S/bentley_schaad/bentley_schaad.aspx?searchtype=SUMMARY&artist=88805 Bentley Schaad Artist Listing]
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Schaad, Bentley}} [[Category:1925 births]] [[Category:1999 deaths]] [[Category:Art educators]] [[Category:Modern painters]]

The '''Norman E. Borlaug International Symposium''', commonly known as the '''Borlaug Dialogue''', is an annual international [[symposium]] tackling the topic of "global [[food security]]" organized by The World Food Prize Foundation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worldfoodprize.org/symposium/symposium.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20011031204038/http://www.worldfoodprize.org/Symposium/symposium.htm|dead-url=yes|archive-date=31 October 2001|title=Past World Food Prize Symposia|publisher=World Food Prize|accessdate=10 May 2009}}</ref> Past symposia have focused on the promises and challenges presented by [[biofuels]] for global development, the dual challenges of [[malnutrition]] and [[obesity]], water insecurity and its impact on development and stability in the Middle East, and the possibility of replicating the [[Green Revolution]]. The 2014 "Borlaug Dialogue" was held on October 15–17, 2014 to coincide with the 100th anniversary of founder [[Norman E. Borlaug|Dr. Norman Borlaug]]'s birth.
2014 Discussion topics<ref>http://www.worldfoodprize.org/index.cfm?nodeID=71721&audienceID=1</ref> ranged from: *taking stock of where we currently stand in meeting the "greatest challenge in human history"; *closing yield gaps while addressing pressing water, gender and nutrition challenges and disparities; *the role of information technology and data to increase productivity, conserve the environment, adapt to climate volatility and consumer needs, and improve the lives of farmers and other participants along the value chain; *sustainable intensification to improve productivity with a special focus on soils and fertilizers; *innovations in insurance and agrofinancing; *and the role of the next generation in the fight against hunger through the DialogueNEXT conversation that features young innovators and thought leaders who are contributing new ideas, concepts and achievements toward this goal.
Notable speakers included: *[[Ernest Bai Koroma]], [[President of Sierra Leone|President]], [[Republic of Sierra Leone]] *[[Kanayo F. Nwanze]], President, [[International Fund for Agricultural Development]] *[[Thomas J. Vilsack]], [[Secretary of Agriculture]], [[United States]] *[[Enrique Martinez y Martinez]], [[Secretariat of Agriculture, Livestock, Rural Development, Fisheries and Food|Secretary of Agriculture]], [[Mexico]] *[[Florence Chenoweth]], [[Ministry of Agriculture (Liberia)|Minister of Agriculture]], [[Liberia]]
==Norman Borlaug Award for Field Research and Application== An annual US $10,000 award endowed by the Rockefeller Foundation which is presented during the symposium by the World Food Prize Foundation to recognise “researchers under 40 who emulate the scientific innovation and dedication to food security of Dr. Norman Borlaug".<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.worldfoodprize.org/en/nominations/the_borlaug_field_award_nomination_procedure/|title= The Norman Borlaug Award for Field Research and Application, Endowed by the Rockefeller Foundation|publisher= The World Food Prize|accessdate = 17 December 2014}}</ref>
'''Recipients''':
Source: [https://www.worldfoodprize.org/en/borlaug_field_award/ World Food Prize] *2016: Andrew Mude, for his ''persistence in his science-based, community mediated, and innovative approach to providing financial protection, through insurance, to millions of poor herders and their families who care for and depend upon their livestock as they move across the vast rangelands of East Africa'' *2015: Eric Pohlman, ''for his work in developing highly innovative programs that are transforming subsistence agriculture in rural Rwanda''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.oneacrefund.org/blogs/information/post/eric-pohlman-wins-2015-norman-borlaug-award/1083|title=Eric Pohlman Wins 2015 Norman Borlaug Award|publisher=One Acre Fund|accessdate = 6 December 2015}}</ref> *2014: Dr. Bram Govaerts, ''for his work developing leading-edge, sustainable programs that are transforming subsistence agriculture and unsustainable farming systems in Mexico and other regions of the world into productive and sustainable production operations.'' <ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.cimmyt.org/en/news-and-updates/press-releases/item/cimmyt-s-bram-govaerts-receives-2014-norman-borlaug-award-for-field-research-and-application|title= CIMMYT’s Bram Govaerts Receives 2014 Norman Borlaug Award for Field Research and Application|publisher= CIMMYT|accessdate= 17 December 2014|deadurl= yes|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20141217143805/http://www.cimmyt.org/en/news-and-updates/press-releases/item/cimmyt-s-bram-govaerts-receives-2014-norman-borlaug-award-for-field-research-and-application|archivedate= 17 December 2014|df= }}</ref> *2013: Dr. Charity Kawira Mutegi, ''for her efforts to identify the cause of, and solution to, a deadly outbreak of aflatoxicosis in 2004-05. Her diligent research led to innovative solutions to avert future outbreaks and safeguard Kenya's staple crop of maize''<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.worldfoodprize.org/en/nominations/norman_borlaug_field_award/2013_recipient/|title=2013 Recipient - The World Food Prize - Improving the Quality, Quantity and Availability of Food in the World|last=globalreach.com|first=Global Reach Internet Productions, LLC - Ames, IA -|website=www.worldfoodprize.org|language=en|access-date=2018-05-31}}</ref>. *2012: Dr. Aditi Mukherji, ''for her research on groundwater resources in agriculture which led to major policy changes benefiting thousands of farmers in West Bengal.''
==References== {{reflist}}
== See also == * [[Norman Borlaug]] * [[World Food Prize]]

revision.text:
'''Bright Flight''' is a [[Missouri]] merit-based scholarship with a current maximum amount of $3000 per annum to Missouri's qualifying graduating high school seniors who enroll in a Missouri accredited college or university. The actual amount of the scholarship is determined based upon state funding and is sometimes less than the maximum amount. From June 2004 to July 2005, 8390 students were enrolled in the Bright Flight program, which totaled over $15 million in state expenditures.
==Qualifications and renewal== *To qualify for the Bright Flight maximum award of $3000 per year, a student must be in the top 3% of his or her statewide high school class as determined by normalized tests, the [[ACT (examination)|ACT]] and [[SAT]] composite scores. To date and for several years, a score of 31 or above on the ACT or an SAT-equivalent score qualifies, but the score can change each year. A composite score of 31 will be needed to qualify for the college freshmen in the 2017-2018 school year. *The law also qualifies students in the 4th and 5th percentiles to receive a $1000 per year maximum scholarship; however, the Missouri Legislature has not funded this award in recent years, and these students have received no actual financial award. An ACT composite score of 30 (or above) qualified for the 4th and 5th percentile for college freshmen in the 2017-2018 school year and recent years. *To continue receiving the scholarship, students must maintain at least a 2.5 [[GPA]] in college and maintain full-time student status to renew the scholarship, which can be renewed for up to five years. *Students must not be pursuing a degree in [[theology]] or [[divinity]]. *Bright Flight students must attend school continuously. They cannot cease attending school, except to work for a non-profit organization, hold a government job, or serve in the armed services. Academic interruption must not exceed 27 months.
==History== Appropriated by the [[Missouri General Assembly]] in 1986, students initially received a statutory maximum of $2000 per year. Many students and higher education officials have observed that tuition expenses at the [[University of Missouri]], for example, were below $2000 in 1987 and thus were '''fully covered''' by Bright Flight at its introduction. In 2017, following a period of increases in tuition expenses that easily outpaced [[inflation]], Bright Flight covered only a fraction of the more than $11,000 a typical student spent on tuition at the University of Missouri.
==Recent developments==
On August 12, 2010, state budget cuts reduced the amount from $2000/year to $1500/year for that year.
On November 25, 2013, Missouri Governor Jay Nixon announced at a college preparatory school in Kansas City, Missouri that he included a proposal in Missouri's 2015 budget that would offer an option to receive up to $5,000 extra per year if recipients stayed in Missouri after finishing college for the number of years they received Bright Flight. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://ksmu.org/article/nixon-new-bright-flight-scholarship-deal-students-who-stay-work-missouri-72779 |title=Archived Document |accessdate=2013-11-27 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203003855/http://ksmu.org/article/nixon-new-bright-flight-scholarship-deal-students-who-stay-work-missouri-72779 |archivedate=2013-12-03 |df= }}</ref>
== References == <references />
==External links==
[[Category:Student financial aid]] [[Category:Education in Missouri]] [[Category:Scholarships in the United States]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = Centralized Application Service for Physician Assistants | founded = 2001 | location = USA | industry = [[University and college admissions|University and College Admissions]] | homepage = https://caspa.liaisoncas.com// }}
'''CASPA''' or the '''Centralized Application Service for Physician Assistants''' is an application service for graduate-level [[Physician assistant|PA]] programs. Similar to the [[Common Application]] used by some undergraduate institutions and the [[American Medical College Application Service]] used by medical schools, CASPA allows students to submit one application to multiple schools. The CASPA application platform is a service offered by the [http://paeaonline.org/ Physician Assistant Education Association] (PAEA).<ref>[http://pafocus.org/caspa/ PA Focus: CASPA]</ref>
==History== The CASPA application service launched in 2001 with 68 participating physician assistant programs, and mailed over 16,000 applications to its member schools. The original service consisted of the CASPA Applicant Portal, which interfaced with students, and the CASPA Admissions Portal, or PA Admit, an admissions software which interfaced directly with PA schools. Completed applications were printed and mailed to programs via postal mail. In 2011, CASPA moved from the PA AdMIT admissions software to WebADMIT, a web-based admissions application which allows schools to receive and review applications online rather than receiving them by mail. Today, over 180 PA programs use CASPA, which accounts for 90% of ARC-PA accredited physician assistant programs in the United States. CASPA annually processes over 100,000 applications.<ref>[http://www.paeaonline.org/ The Physician Assistant Education Association (PAEA)]</ref>
In 2015, CASPA moved its Applicant Portal to an entirely new software platform, called CAS 3.0. New aspects of the platform included a visual, image-based user interface as opposed to the previous text-based interface, and all payments and fee waiver submission forms moved to an entirely electronic format. The platform also included the addition of "Program Materials," a section of the application in which PA programs could configure and collect specific documentation and other information for their program directly through the CASPA application.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQvZ9BjjdF0 The Physician Assistant Education Association (PAEA) 3.0 CASPA Demo]</ref>
==Member Programs== PA Programs must be accredited by ARC-PA and be a member of PAEA in order to participate in CASPA as full-fledged programs. New PA programs who have applied for, but not yet received accreditation from ARC-PA may participate for one application cycle as a "developing program." All programs which participate in CASPA are graduate-level programs which require that students have completed at least some college-level coursework prior to applying. The small number of bachelor's degree-level PA programs which accept students straight from high school study do not use the CASPA application. Applicants may determine whether or not the programs they are interested in applying to use CASPA by searching the [http://directory.paeaonline.org/ PA Program Directory].<ref>[http://directory.paeaonline.org/ PA Program Directory]</ref>
==Features== CASPA is open for applicants to apply to PA programs for roughly eleven months each year. Its open period, called an "application cycle," runs annually from mid-April through March 1.<ref>[https://portal.caspaonline.org/caspaHelpPages/about-caspaoverview/ CASPA Overview]</ref> To use the application, applicants must register a user account and fill out standard blocks of application material which is sent to all programs to which they apply. Standard application information includes personal information, academic history, work experience, health care certifications, awards and honors received, professional memberships, references, standardized test scores, and a personal essay documenting an applicant's interest in the physician assistant profession. Applicants must also submit official academic transcripts to CASPA and request at least three letters of reference in order to submit their applications to a PA program. All of this information is provided once and accessed by each school to which the applicant chooses to apply.<ref>[http://help.unicas.com:8888/caspaHelpPages/frequently-asked-questions/index.html CASPA Instructions and FAQ]</ref>
The PA programs themselves have varying deadlines which occur during each application cycle. Those deadlines also have varying requirements based upon the individual PA program, which the applicants must research and adhere to in order to be considered by the school. PA programs also document their additional requirements on the "Program Materials" section of the CASPA application, where they have the ability to require additional documents to be uploaded, questions to be answered, and/or prerequisite courses to be marked as completed in order for an applicant to submit their application to that program specifically. Applying to PA programs via CASPA costs $177 for an application to be submitted to one school, and an additional $51 for each subsequent school.<ref>[https://portal.caspaonline.org/caspaHelpPages/frequently-asked-questions/school-information/submitting-paymentsfee-waivers/index.html CASPA Fees and Payments FAQ]</ref> In addition, some PA programs charge supplemental application fees or require applicants to submit supplemental documentation.
==External links== *[https://caspa.liaisoncas.com/ CASPA Application] *[http://paeaonline.org/ The Physician Assistant Education Association (PAEA)] *[http://www.physicianassistantforum.com/index.php?/forum/501-caspa/ CASPA on the PA Forum] *[http://pafocus.org/ PA Focus for PA Applicants]
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:University and college admissions]]
